name: xephthalmia
sign_and_symptoms: Night blindness, poor growth, dryness and keratinization of epithelial tissues
function: Involved in immune function, vision, cell growth and cell communication.

name: Microcytic anemia
sign_and_symptoms: Microcytic anemia, scaling of the lips and cracks in the corners of the mouth, swollen tongue, depression, and confusion
function: Involved in greater than 100 enzyme reactions in the body and involved in protein metabolism.

name: Megaloblastic anemia
sign_and_symptoms: Megaloblastic anemia, fatigue, weakness, constipation, loss of appetite, and weight loss
function: Involved in red blood cell formation, neurological function, and DNA synthesis.

name: Scuvy
sign_and_symptoms: Development of scurvy which would include: fatigue, inflammation of the gums, delayed wound healing, internal bleeding, abnormal formation of bones and teeth and weakened connective tissue
function: Involved in the formation of collagen, certain neurotransmitters, and protein synthesis. Helps the body to absorb calcium and iron, makes blood vessels stronger, promotes wound healing, protects the immune system, plays a role in synthesis of hormones and other body chemicals, acts as an anti-oxidant

name: Rickets
sign_and_symptoms: Development of rickets in children or osteomalacia in adults, weakened bones and fatigue
function: Promotes calcium absorption and proper bone formation, involved in cell growth, immune function, and reduces inflammation. Helps minerals to be deposited in bones and teeth (prevents rickets)

name: Megaloblastic anemia
sign_and_symptoms: Megaloblastic anemia
function: Involved in the synthesis of RNA and DNA and is required for cell division and the prevention of Neural Tube defects.

name: Beriberi
sign_and_symptoms: nerve degeneration, altered muscle coordination, cardiovascular problems
function: Helps the body use macronutrients for energy and other purposes

name: Pellagra
sign_and_symptoms: diarrhea, skin inflammation, dementia
function: helps turn the food you eat into the energy you need. Niacin is important for the development and function of the cells in your body

name: Anemia and cataracts
sign_and_symptoms: skin disorders, hyperemia (excess blood) and edema of the mouth and throat, angular stomatitis (lesions at the corners of the mouth), cheilosis (swollen, cracked lips), hair loss, reproductive problems, sore throat, itchy and red eyes, and degeneration of the liver and nervous system
function: Helps maintain normal levels of homocysteine, an amino acid in the blood, repair tissues-essential during pregnancy for new maternal and foetal tissue

name: Crohn’s disease, cystic fibrosis, and certain rare genetic diseases such as abetalipoproteinemia and ataxia
sign_and_symptoms: Nerve and muscle damage that results in loss of feeling in the arms and legs, loss of body movement control, muscle weakness, and vision problems
function: Required for the health of the reproductive system, nerves and muscles, Maintains healthy skin, Acts as an anti-oxidant. help older adults remain mentally alert and active as well as prevent or slow the decline of mental function and Alzheimer’s disease.

name: Anaemia
sign_and_symptoms: bleeding and hemorrhage
function: Used to manufacture proteins in blood plasma, Responsible for blood clotting, Important for maintaining healthy bone and kidney tissues, Required for synthesis of hormones, Required for the carboxylation of osteocalcin in bone

name: Cancers
sign_and_symptoms: Risk of lung cancer, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, pancreatic cancer, oral cavity cancer, laryngeal cancer, esophageal cancer, ovarian cancer, glioma, and bladder cancer
function: For reproduction (embryonic development, maintenance of male genital tract and Spermatogenesis), help prevent cancer or lower the chances of dying of cancer

name: Osteoporosis
sign_and_symptoms: Development of osteoporosis
function: Involved in muscle function, nerve transmission, and proper bone formation.

name: Goitre
sign_and_symptoms: Stunted growth, enlarged thyroid gland, poor growth in infancy and childhood, possible mental retardation, cretinism and neurodevelopmental deficits
function: A component of thyroid hormones that regulate protein synthesis, metabolism, and enzyme activity.

name: Iron-deficiency anemia
sign_and_symptoms: Microcytic, hypochromic anemia; impaired cognitive function, poor body temperature regulation, depressed immune function, decreased work output, reduced growth, increased health risk in pregnancy and spoon like shape of nails
function: A component of hemoglobin and therefore important in the transfer of oxygen from the lungs to organs, and involved in the synthesis of hormones as well as normal growth and development.

name: hypocalcemia or hypokalemia
sign_and_symptoms: Loss of appetite, fatigue, weakness, nausea, vomiting, numbness, tingling, muscle cramps, seizures, personality changes, and abnormal heart rhythms
function: Involved in more than 300 enzyme reactions, protein synthesis, muscle function, nerve function, blood sugar control, and blood pressure control.

name: Stunted growth
sign_and_symptoms: Stunted growth, depressed immune function, hair loss, eye and skin lesions, delayed wound healing, and taste alterations
function: Involved in cell metabolism, enzyme activity, immune function, protein synthesis, wound healing, DNA synthesis, and cell division.

name: Hyponatremia (low blood sodium)
sign_and_symptoms: Muscle cramps, nausea, dizziness, weakness, and eventually shock and coma
function: Works with potassium to maintain healthy blood pressure and normal function of nerves and muscles. Works with potassium to maintain water balance and acid-base equilibrium in the body fluids. Vital for muscle sensitivity. Essential for transport of glucose and other nutrients across membranes. Plays a role in the function of the adrenal gland

name: Hypokalemia, cardiac arrhythmias
sign_and_symptoms: Weakness, loss of appetite, muscle cramps, and confusion. Increase blood pressure, kidney stone risk, bone turnover, urinary calcium excretion, and salt sensitivity
function: required for normal cell function because of its role in maintaining intracellular fluid volume and transmembrane electrochemical gradients

name: Dehydration (water deficiency), gastroenteritis in children
sign_and_symptoms: Thirst, dry mouth, sunken eyes, poor skin turgor, cold hands and feet, weak and rapid pulse, rapid and shallow breathing, confusion, exhaustion, and coma.
function: restore fluids lost through metabolism, breathing, sweating, and the removal of waste. It helps to keep you from overheating, lubricates the joints and tissues, maintains healthy skin, and is necessary for proper digestion.
